Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/round_prec.c

24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26#define mpfr_round_raw_generic mpfr_round_raw
27#define flag 0
28#define use_inexp 1
29#include "round_raw_generic.c"
30
31#define mpfr_round_raw_generic mpfr_round_raw_2
32#define flag 1
33#define use_inexp 0
34#include "round_raw_generic.c"
35
36/* Seems to be unused. Remove comment to implement it.
37#define mpfr_round_raw_generic mpfr_round_raw_3
38#define flag 1
39#define use_inexp 1
40#include "round_raw_generic.c"
41*/
42
43#define mpfr_round_raw_generic mpfr_round_raw_4
44#define flag 0
45#define use_inexp 0
46#include "round_raw_generic.c"
47
48/* Note: if the new prec is lower than the current one, a reallocation
49 must not be done (see exp_2.c). */
50
51int
52mpfr_prec_round (mpfr_ptr x, mpfr_prec_t prec, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
53{
54 mp_limb_t *tmp, *xp;
55 int carry, inexact;
56 mpfr_prec_t nw, ow;
57 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
58
59 MPFR_ASSERTN (MPFR_PREC_COND (prec));
60
61 nw = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (prec); /* needed allocated limbs */
62
63 /* check if x has enough allocated space for the significand */
64 /* Get the number of limbs from the precision.
65 (Compatible with all allocation methods) */
66 ow = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (x);
67 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (nw > ow))
68 {
69 /* FIXME: Variable can't be created using custom allocation,
70 MPFR_DECL_INIT or GROUP_ALLOC: How to detect? */
71 ow = MPFR_GET_ALLOC_SIZE(x);
72 if (nw > ow)
73 {
74 mpfr_size_limb_t *tmpx;
75
76 /* Realloc significand */
77 tmpx = (mpfr_size_limb_t *) mpfr_reallocate_func
78 (MPFR_GET_REAL_PTR(x), MPFR_MALLOC_SIZE(ow), MPFR_MALLOC_SIZE(nw));
79 MPFR_SET_MANT_PTR(x, tmpx); /* mant ptr must be set
80 before alloc size */
81 MPFR_SET_ALLOC_SIZE(x, nw); /* new number of allocated limbs */
82 }
83 }
84
85 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY( MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(x) ))
86 {
87 MPFR_PREC(x) = prec; /* Special value: need to set prec */
88 if (MPFR_IS_NAN(x))
89 MPFR_RET_NAN;
90 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_INF(x) || MPFR_IS_ZERO(x));
91 return 0; /* infinity and zero are exact */
92 }
93
94 /* x is a non-zero real number */
95
96 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
97 tmp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (nw);
98 xp = MPFR_MANT(x);
99 carry = mpfr_round_raw (tmp, xp, MPFR_PREC(x), MPFR_IS_NEG(x),
100 prec, rnd_mode, &inexact);
101 MPFR_PREC(x) = prec;
102
103 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(carry))
104 {
105 mpfr_exp_t exp = MPFR_EXP (x);
106
107 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(exp == __gmpfr_emax))
108 (void) mpfr_overflow(x, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(x));
109 else
110 {
111 MPFR_ASSERTD (exp < __gmpfr_emax);
112 MPFR_SET_EXP (x, exp + 1);
113 xp[nw - 1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
114 if (nw - 1 > 0)
115 MPN_ZERO(xp, nw - 1);
116 }
117 }
118 else
119 MPN_COPY(xp, tmp, nw);
120
121 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
122 return inexact;
123}
124
125/* assumption: GMP_NUMB_BITS is a power of 2 */
126
127/* assuming b is an approximation to x in direction rnd1 with error at
128 most 2^(MPFR_EXP(b)-err), returns 1 if one is able to round exactly
129 x to precision prec with direction rnd2, and 0 otherwise.
130 Side effects: none.
131
132 rnd1 = RNDN and RNDF are similar: the sign of the error is unknown.
133
134 rnd2 = RNDF: assume that the user will round the approximation b
135 toward the direction of x, i.e. the opposite of rnd1 in directed
136 rounding modes, otherwise RNDN. Some details:
137
138 u xinf v xsup w
139 -----|----+----------|--+------------|-----
140 [----- x -----]
141 rnd1 = RNDD b |
142 rnd1 = RNDU b
143
144 where u, v and w are consecutive machine numbers.
145
146 * If [xinf,xsup] contains no machine numbers, then return 1.
147
148 * If [xinf,xsup] contains 2 machine numbers, then return 0.
149
150 * If [xinf,xsup] contains a single machine number, then return 1 iff
151 the rounding of b is this machine number.
152 With the above choice for the rounding of b, this will always be
153 the case if rnd1 is a directed rounding mode; said otherwise, for
154 rnd2 = RNDF and rnd1 being a directed rounding mode, return 1 iff
155 [xinf,xsup] contains at most 1 machine number.
156*/
157
158int
159mpfr_can_round (mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_exp_t err, mpfr_rnd_t rnd1,
160 mpfr_rnd_t rnd2, mpfr_prec_t prec)
161{
162 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(b)))
163 return 0; /* We cannot round if Zero, Nan or Inf */
164 else
165 return mpfr_can_round_raw (MPFR_MANT(b), MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(b),
166 MPFR_SIGN(b), err, rnd1, rnd2, prec);
167}
168
169/* TODO: mpfr_can_round_raw currently does a memory allocation and some
170 mpn operations. A bit inspection like for mpfr_round_p (round_p.c) may
171 be sufficient, though this would be more complex than the one done in
172 mpfr_round_p, and in particular, for some rnd1/rnd2 combinations, one
173 needs to take care of changes of binade when the value is close to a
174 power of 2. */
175
176int
177mpfr_can_round_raw (const mp_limb_t *bp, mp_size_t bn, int neg, mpfr_exp_t err,
178 mpfr_rnd_t rnd1, mpfr_rnd_t rnd2, mpfr_prec_t prec)
179{
180 mpfr_prec_t prec2;
181 mp_size_t k, k1, tn;
182 int s, s1;
183 mp_limb_t cc, cc2;
184 mp_limb_t *tmp;
185 mp_limb_t cy = 0, tmp_hi;
186 int res;
187 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
188
189 /* Since mpfr_can_round is a function in the API, use MPFR_ASSERTN.
190 The specification makes sense only for prec >= 1. */
191 MPFR_ASSERTN (prec >= 1);
192
193 MPFR_ASSERTD(bp[bn - 1] & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT);
194
195 MPFR_ASSERT_SIGN(neg);
196 neg = MPFR_IS_NEG_SIGN(neg);
197
198 /* Transform RNDD and RNDU to Zero / Away */
199 MPFR_ASSERTD (neg == 0 || neg == 1);
200 /* transform RNDF to RNDN */
201 if (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDF)
202 rnd1 = MPFR_RNDN;
203 if (rnd1 != MPFR_RNDN)
204 rnd1 = MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd1, neg) ? MPFR_RNDZ : MPFR_RNDA;
205 if (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDF)
206 rnd2 = (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN) ? MPFR_RNDN :
207 MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd2, neg) ? MPFR_RNDA : MPFR_RNDZ;
208 if (rnd2 != MPFR_RNDN)
209 rnd2 = MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd2, neg) ? MPFR_RNDZ : MPFR_RNDA;
210
211 /* For err < prec (+1 for rnd1=RNDN), we can never round correctly, since
212 the error is at least 2*ulp(b) >= ulp(round(b)).
213 However for err = prec (+1 for rnd1=RNDN), we can round correctly in some
214 rare cases where ulp(b) = 1/2*ulp(U) [see below for the definition of U],
215 which implies rnd1 = RNDZ or RNDN, and rnd2 = RNDA or RNDN. */
216
217 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (err < prec + (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN) ||
218 (err == prec + (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN) &&
219 (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDA ||
220 rnd2 == MPFR_RNDZ))))
221 return 0; /* can't round */
222
223 /* As a consequence... */
224 MPFR_ASSERTD (err >= prec);
225
226 /* The bound c on the error |x-b| is: c = 2^(MPFR_EXP(b)-err) <= b/2.
227 * So, we now know that x and b have the same sign. By symmetry,
228 * assume x > 0 and b > 0. We have: L <= x <= U, where, depending
229 * on rnd1:
230 * MPFR_RNDN: L = b-c, U = b+c
231 * MPFR_RNDZ: L = b, U = b+c
232 * MPFR_RNDA: L = b-c, U = b
233 *
234 * We can round x iff round(L,prec,rnd2) = round(U,prec,rnd2).
235 */
236
237 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (prec > (mpfr_prec_t) bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS))
238 { /* Then prec > PREC(b): we can round:
239 (i) in rounding to the nearest as long as err >= prec + 2.
240 When err = prec + 1 and b is not a power
241 of two (so that a change of binade cannot occur), then one
242 can round to nearest thanks to the even rounding rule (in the
243 target precision prec, the significand of b ends with a 0).
244 When err = prec + 1 and b is a power of two, when rnd1 = RNDZ one
245 can round too.
246 (ii) in directed rounding mode iff rnd1 is compatible with rnd2
247 and err >= prec + 1, unless b = 2^k and rnd1 = RNDA or RNDN in
248 which case we need err >= prec + 2.
249 */
250 if ((rnd1 == rnd2 || rnd2 == MPFR_RNDN) && err >= prec + 1)
251 {
252 if (rnd1 != MPFR_RNDZ &&
253 err == prec + 1 &&
254 mpfr_powerof2_raw2 (bp, bn))
255 return 0;
256 else
257 return 1;
258 }
259 return 0;
260 }
261
262 /* now prec <= bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS */
263
264 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (err > (mpfr_prec_t) bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS))
265 {
266 /* we distinguish the case where b is a power of two:
267 rnd1 rnd2 can round?
268 RNDZ RNDZ ok
269 RNDZ RNDA no
270 RNDZ RNDN ok
271 RNDA RNDZ no
272 RNDA RNDA ok except when err = prec + 1
273 RNDA RNDN ok except when err = prec + 1
274 RNDN RNDZ no
275 RNDN RNDA no
276 RNDN RNDN ok except when err = prec + 1 */
277 if (mpfr_powerof2_raw2 (bp, bn))
278 {
279 if ((rnd2 == MPFR_RNDZ || rnd2 == MPFR_RNDA) && rnd1 != rnd2)
280 return 0;
281 else if (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDZ)
282 return 1; /* RNDZ RNDZ and RNDZ RNDN */
283 else
284 return err > prec + 1;
285 }
286
287 /* now the general case where b is not a power of two:
288 rnd1 rnd2 can round?
289 RNDZ RNDZ ok
290 RNDZ RNDA except when b is representable in precision 'prec'
291 RNDZ RNDN except when b is the middle of two representable numbers in
292 precision 'prec' and b ends with 'xxx0[1]',
293 or b is representable in precision 'prec'
294 and err = prec + 1 and b ends with '1'.
295 RNDA RNDZ except when b is representable in precision 'prec'
296 RNDA RNDA ok
297 RNDA RNDN except when b is the middle of two representable numbers in
298 precision 'prec' and b ends with 'xxx1[1]',
299 or b is representable in precision 'prec'
300 and err = prec + 1 and b ends with '1'.
301 RNDN RNDZ except when b is representable in precision 'prec'
302 RNDN RNDA except when b is representable in precision 'prec'
303 RNDN RNDN except when b is the middle of two representable numbers in
304 precision 'prec', or b is representable in precision 'prec'
305 and err = prec + 1 and b ends with '1'. */
306 if (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDN)
307 {
308 if (err == prec + 1 && (bp[0] & 1))
309 return 0; /* err == prec + 1 implies prec = bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS */
310 if (prec < (mpfr_prec_t) bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
311 {
312 k1 = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (prec + 1);
313 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(s1, prec + 1);
314 if (((bp[bn - k1] >> s1) & 1) &&
315 mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, MPFR_RNDA, prec + 1) == 0)
316 { /* b is the middle of two representable numbers */
317 if (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN)
318 return 0;
319 k1 = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (prec);
320 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(s1, prec);
321 return (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDZ) ^
322 (((bp[bn - k1] >> s1) & 1) == 0);
323 }
324 }
325 return 1;
326 }
327 else if (rnd1 == rnd2)
328 {
329 if (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN && prec < (mpfr_prec_t) bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
330 {
331 /* then rnd2 = RNDN, and for prec = bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS we cannot
332 have b the middle of two representable numbers */
333 k1 = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (prec + 1);
334 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(s1, prec + 1);
335 if (((bp[bn - k1] >> s1) & 1) &&
336 mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, MPFR_RNDA, prec + 1) == 0)
337 /* b is representable in precision prec+1 and ends with a 1 */
338 return 0;
339 else
340 return 1;
341 }
342 else
343 return 1;
344 }
345 else
346 return mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, MPFR_RNDA, prec) != 0;
347 }
348
349 /* now err <= bn * GMP_NUMB_BITS */
350
351 /* warning: if k = m*GMP_NUMB_BITS, consider limb m-1 and not m */
352 k = (err - 1) / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
353 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(s, err);
354 /* the error corresponds to bit s in limb k, the most significant limb
355 being limb 0; in memory, limb k is bp[bn-1-k]. */
356
357 k1 = (prec - 1) / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
358 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(s1, prec);
359 /* the least significant bit is bit s1 in limb k1 */
360
361 /* We don't need to consider the k1 most significant limbs.
362 They will be considered later only to detect when subtracting
363 the error bound yields a change of binade.
364 Warning! The number with updated bn may no longer be normalized. */
365 k -= k1;
366 bn -= k1;
367 prec2 = prec - (mpfr_prec_t) k1 * GMP_NUMB_BITS;
368
369 /* We can decide of the correct rounding if rnd2(b-eps) and rnd2(b+eps)
370 give the same result to the target precision 'prec', i.e., if when
371 adding or subtracting (1 << s) in bp[bn-1-k], it does not change the
372 rounding in direction 'rnd2' at ulp-position bp[bn-1] >> s1, taking also
373 into account the possible change of binade. */
374 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
375 tn = bn;
376 k++; /* since we work with k+1 everywhere */
377 tmp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (tn);
378 if (bn > k)
379 MPN_COPY (tmp, bp, bn - k);
380
381 MPFR_ASSERTD (k > 0);
382
383 switch (rnd1)
384 {
385 case MPFR_RNDZ:
386 /* rnd1 = Round to Zero */
387 cc = (bp[bn - 1] >> s1) & 1;
388 /* mpfr_round_raw2 returns 1 if one should add 1 at ulp(b,prec),
389 and 0 otherwise */
390 cc ^= mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, rnd2, prec2);
391 /* cc is the new value of bit s1 in bp[bn-1] after rounding 'rnd2' */
392
393 /* now round b + 2^(MPFR_EXP(b)-err) */
394 cy = mpn_add_1 (tmp + bn - k, bp + bn - k, k, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << s);
395 /* propagate carry up to most significant limb */
396 for (tn = 0; tn + 1 < k1 && cy != 0; tn ++)
397 cy = ~bp[bn + tn] == 0;
398 if (cy == 0 && err == prec)
399 {
400 res = 0;
401 goto end;
402 }
403 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(cy))
404 {
405 /* when a carry occurs, we have b < 2^h <= b+c, we can round iff:
406 rnd2 = RNDZ: never, since b and b+c round to different values;
407 rnd2 = RNDA: when b+c is an exact power of two, and err > prec
408 (since for err = prec, b = 2^h - 1/2*ulp(2^h) is
409 exactly representable and thus rounds to itself);
410 rnd2 = RNDN: whenever cc = 0, since err >= prec implies
411 c <= ulp(b) = 1/2*ulp(2^h), thus b+c rounds to 2^h,
412 and b+c >= 2^h implies that bit 'prec' of b is 1,
413 thus cc = 0 means that b is rounded to 2^h too. */
414 res = (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDZ) ? 0
415 : (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDA) ? (err > prec && k == bn && tmp[0] == 0)
416 : cc == 0;
417 goto end;
418 }
419 break;
420 case MPFR_RNDN:
421 /* rnd1 = Round to nearest */
422
423 /* first round b+2^(MPFR_EXP(b)-err) */
424 cy = mpn_add_1 (tmp + bn - k, bp + bn - k, k, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << s);
425 /* propagate carry up to most significant limb */
426 for (tn = 0; tn + 1 < k1 && cy != 0; tn ++)
427 cy = ~bp[bn + tn] == 0;
428 cc = (tmp[bn - 1] >> s1) & 1; /* gives 0 when cc=1 */
429 cc ^= mpfr_round_raw2 (tmp, bn, neg, rnd2, prec2);
430 /* cc is the new value of bit s1 in bp[bn-1]+eps after rounding 'rnd2' */
431 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (cy != 0))
432 {
433 /* when a carry occurs, we have b-c < b < 2^h <= b+c, we can round
434 iff:
435 rnd2 = RNDZ: never, since b-c and b+c round to different values;
436 rnd2 = RNDA: when b+c is an exact power of two, and
437 err > prec + 1 (since for err <= prec + 1,
438 b-c <= 2^h - 1/2*ulp(2^h) is exactly representable
439 and thus rounds to itself);
440 rnd2 = RNDN: whenever err > prec + 1, since for err = prec + 1,
441 b+c rounds to 2^h, and b-c rounds to nextbelow(2^h).
442 For err > prec + 1, c <= 1/4*ulp(b) <= 1/8*ulp(2^h),
443 thus
444 2^h - 1/4*ulp(b) <= b-c < b+c <= 2^h + 1/8*ulp(2^h),
445 therefore both b-c and b+c round to 2^h. */
446 res = (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDZ) ? 0
447 : (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDA) ? (err > prec + 1 && k == bn && tmp[0] == 0)
448 : err > prec + 1;
449 goto end;
450 }
451 subtract_eps:
452 /* now round b-2^(MPFR_EXP(b)-err), this happens for
453 rnd1 = RNDN or RNDA */
454 MPFR_ASSERTD(rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN || rnd1 == MPFR_RNDA);
455 cy = mpn_sub_1 (tmp + bn - k, bp + bn - k, k, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << s);
456 /* propagate the potential borrow up to the most significant limb
457 (it cannot propagate further since the most significant limb is
458 at least MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT).
459 Note: we use the same limb tmp[bn-1] to subtract. */
460 tmp_hi = tmp[bn - 1];
461 for (tn = 0; tn < k1 && cy != 0; tn ++)
462 cy = mpn_sub_1 (&tmp_hi, bp + bn + tn, 1, cy);
463 /* We have an exponent decrease when tn = k1 and
464 tmp[bn-1] < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT:
465 b-c < 2^h <= b (for RNDA) or b+c (for RNDN).
466 Then we surely cannot round when rnd2 = RNDZ, since b or b+c round to
467 a value >= 2^h, and b-c rounds to a value < 2^h.
468 We also surely cannot round when (rnd1,rnd2) = (RNDN,RNDA), since
469 b-c rounds to a value <= 2^h, and b+c > 2^h rounds to a value > 2^h.
470 It thus remains:
471 (rnd1,rnd2) = (RNDA,RNDA), (RNDA,RNDN) and (RNDN,RNDN).
472 For (RNDA,RNDA) we can round only when b-c and b round to 2^h, which
473 implies b = 2^h and err > prec (which is true in that case):
474 a necessary condition is that cc = 0.
475 For (RNDA,RNDN) we can round only when b-c and b round to 2^h, which
476 implies b-c >= 2^h - 1/4*ulp(2^h), and b <= 2^h + 1/2*ulp(2^h);
477 since ulp(2^h) = ulp(b), this implies c <= 3/4*ulp(b), thus
478 err > prec.
479 For (RNDN,RNDN) we can round only when b-c and b+c round to 2^h,
480 which implies b-c >= 2^h - 1/4*ulp(2^h), and
481 b+c <= 2^h + 1/2*ulp(2^h);
482 since ulp(2^h) = ulp(b), this implies 2*c <= 3/4*ulp(b), thus
483 err > prec+1.
484 */
485 if (tn == k1 && tmp_hi < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT) /* exponent decrease */
486 {
487 if (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDZ || (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN && rnd2 == MPFR_RNDA) ||
488 cc != 0 /* b or b+c does not round to 2^h */)
489 {
490 res = 0;
491 goto end;
492 }
493 /* in that case since the most significant bit of tmp is 0, we
494 should consider one more bit; res = 0 when b-c does not round
495 to 2^h. */
496 res = mpfr_round_raw2 (tmp, bn, neg, rnd2, prec2 + 1) != 0;
497 goto end;
498 }
499 if (err == prec + (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDN))
500 {
501 /* No exponent increase nor decrease, thus we have |U-L| = ulp(b).
502 For rnd2 = RNDZ or RNDA, either [L,U] contains one representable
503 number in the target precision, and then L and U round
504 differently; or both L and U are representable: they round
505 differently too; thus in all cases we cannot round.
506 For rnd2 = RNDN, the only case where we can round is when the
507 middle of [L,U] (i.e. b) is representable, and ends with a 0. */
508 res = (rnd2 == MPFR_RNDN && (((bp[bn - 1] >> s1) & 1) == 0) &&
509 mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, MPFR_RNDZ, prec2) ==
510 mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, MPFR_RNDA, prec2));
511 goto end;
512 }
513 break;
514 default:
515 /* rnd1 = Round away */
516 MPFR_ASSERTD (rnd1 == MPFR_RNDA);
517 cc = (bp[bn - 1] >> s1) & 1;
518 /* the mpfr_round_raw2() call below returns whether one should add 1 or
519 not for rounding */
520 cc ^= mpfr_round_raw2 (bp, bn, neg, rnd2, prec2);
521 /* cc is the new value of bit s1 in bp[bn-1]+eps after rounding 'rnd2' */
522
523 goto subtract_eps;
524 }
525
526 cc2 = (tmp[bn - 1] >> s1) & 1;
527 res = cc == (cc2 ^ mpfr_round_raw2 (tmp, bn, neg, rnd2, prec2));
528
529 end:
530 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
531 return res;
532}
